meanings.definition: A group of people hired to applaud or heckle at a performance.
meanings.sent1: The claqueurs cheered loudly at the end of the play.
meanings.sent2: The theater hired claqueurs to create a lively atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The claqueurs added to the excitement of the show with their enthusiastic applause.
meanings.sent4: The claqueurs were like a wave of sound, filling the theater with energy.
meanings.sent5: The claqueurs' applause echoed through the hall, enhancing the performance.

meanings.definition: A person who is part of a group hired to applaud or heckle at a performance.
meanings.sent1: One of the claqueurs stood up and clapped enthusiastically.
meanings.sent2: The claqueurs' presence made the audience more engaged.
meanings.sent3: The claqueurs' cheers were so loud, they almost stole the show.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a claqueurs, adding her voice to the chorus of approval.
meanings.sent5: The claqueurs' reactions were contagious, spreading excitement among the spectators.
